subject: AI & Agents
title: Surveillance and the All-Seeing Eye
description: A micro-lesson that makes Surveillance and the All-Seeing Eye usable.

hook.text: China has 700 million surveillance cameras. AI connects them into one system that tracks everyone.

buildup.text: AI-powered surveillance can identify faces, track movements, and predict behavior at scale.

discovery.text: Social credit systems use AI to score citizens based on behavior â€” jaywalking, debt, online posts.

twist.text: Western democracies use similar technology for 'smart cities' and 'public safety.'

climax.text: The difference between safety and control depends on who holds the camera.

punchline.text: Privacy dies one camera at a time.

quiz.question: What concern do AI surveillance systems raise?
options: They can track and score citizens at massive scale
They only work in authoritarian countries
They are too expensive to be widespread
